author: cnbc.com
title: Central Garden tops Street 1Q forecasts
text:
WALNUT CREEK, Calif. (AP) _ Central Garden & Pet Co. (CENT) on Wednesday reported fiscal first-quarter earnings of $26.2 million.
On a per-share basis, the Walnut Creek, California-based company said it had profit of 50 cents. Earnings, adjusted for pretax gains, came to 19 cents per share.
The results surpassed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of three analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 15 cents per share.
The maker of products for the pet supply and lawn and garden markets posted revenue of $442 million in the period, which also topped Street forecasts. Three analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $434.3 million.
Central Garden expects full-year earnings to be $1.85 per share.
Central Garden shares have decreased slightly more than 6 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $36.42, an increase of 14 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on CENT at https://www.zacks.com/ap/CENT
